tourBios.exmtStatus: Exempt - Finished 11-45 at 2015 Web.com Tour Qualifying Tournament (exempt to second reshuffle)
tourBios.carHigh: 2015:Played on the Swing Thought Tour during the summer and won two tournaments.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Became the sixth player in Georgia Tech history to earn All-ACC honors four times and the 16th player to do so in ACC history...Won the 2015 Byron Nelson Award as the nation's top graduating senior golfer...Three-time All-American at Georgia Tech...Was named to the U.S. team for the 2015 Palmer CupâŚIn 57 career events, recorded 21 top-10 finishes, including 13 in the top-fives and three wins (2013 and 2015 ACC Championships, co-medalist at 2015 Robert Kepler Intercollegiate)...Counting ACC and NCAA championships, had six top-10 finishes in postseason events...One of only five players ever to win two ACC titles. Finished in the top five the other two times
tourBios.personal: Was in the same major and took classes with Ollie Schniederjans while at Georgia Tech...First-tee entrance song would be "Last of a Dying Breed."...Biggest thrill in golf was helping Georgia Tech win the ACC Championship...Favorite book is Heart of a Warrior...Would love to be featured in Men's Health, his favorite magazine...Favorite athlete is Steph Curry and is big fan of the Golden State Warriors and all professional teams in Atlanta...Had the opportunity to meet Arnold Palmer the year he played in the Palmer Cup. Also bested fellow Yellow Jacket Matt Kuchar in a friendly golf match...Favorite golf courses include Augusta National, Oak Hill and Nanea GC in Hawaii...Twittername is @AndersAlbertson

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the Web.com Tour in 2016 is 3rd at the Brasil Champions presented by Embrase.
dyn.dynStats: He ranks 15th in Driving Distance on the Web.com Tour.
